casebody.data:
AT SOMERSET NISI PRIUS

-----Term 1791.

Before Kinsey C. J. and Chetwood J.

Denn Ex-dem. M‘Donalb against King and King. Where testator directs his executors to sell lands, and they renounce, and administration is granted cum testamento annexo> the administrators are not authorized to sell. A party is estopped from, gainsaying a title wldcli is recognized ¡>y a deed under which he himself claims. IN the trial of this cause Kinsey C. J. held with the concurrence of Chetwood J. — that where testator directed his lands to be sold by his executors, this was a personal trust; and as the executors renounced, there was no one by whom the duty could be fulfilled. A sale by administrators cum testamenta annexo, was altogether unauthorized and void. %d That as the deed, under which the lessor of the plain-» tiff claimed, was expressly recognized in that which is the foundation of the defendant’s title, the defendant is estopped from questioning or gainsaying it .(a)

Note See Embree v. Ellis 2 Johns. 119.

After the jury were charged by the court the plaintiff suffered a voluntary nonsuit.
